intro: Sanicula europaea var. chinensis, commonly known as Chinese sanicle, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in umbrella-shaped clusters and are pollinated by insects. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
